descriptions: Led the development of LoveLoop, an immersive 3D fertility awareness training application in Unreal Engine 5, project served to 70,000+ members of the University of British Columbia community for interactive learning.
Developed and deployed an internal inspective inventory system plugin, served 200+ engineers across UBC IT.
Engineered modular gameplay features via Unreal Blueprints, cutting iteration time by 40%.
Managed 100+ development tasks using Trello for in-team coordination, while overseeing project infrastructure through Amazon S3, server-side cloud services, and data tracking with Excel.
Integrated Perforce Helix Core to streamline collaboration and version control.
Authored 3+ technical documentation and developer journals to support maintainability and knowledge sharing.

gallery.text: Grateful for having the opportunity to present LoveLoop to the UBC community.
Shocasing our project to faculty UBC faculty members and emerging media experts.
Capture the moment, the LoveLoop team forever.
Capture the moment, the LoveLoop team forever.

descriptions: Engineered RL agents in Unity with ML-Agents Toolkit for sim-to-real bipedal locomotion.
Engineered RL agent logic in C#, tuned hyperparameters, applied domain randomization, and leveraged TensorBoard for real-time training visualization and performance tracking.
Architected a system identification data processing pipeline to enable reliable sim-to-real transfer of learned policies.

descriptions: Core frontend engineer of the official iGEM UBC 2025 wiki and UBC iGEM official website, delivering a fully responsive and accessible platform built with Astro, React, and TypeScript, featuring 200+ statically generated pages optimized for high load efficiency and performance.
Architected and implemented modular, reusable UI components, boosting iteration speed by 40%.
Built responsive layouts and interactive 3D visualizations using Three.js, improving engagement and interactivity.
